item.title: 俄罗斯称无法建造北极航道所需的所有船只
item.description: 俄罗斯副总理尤里-特鲁特涅夫（Yury Trutnev）表示，俄罗斯正面临着巨大的 "北方海路 "项目所需的冰级货船短缺问题，因为俄罗斯无法自行建造船队。【原文：Russia is facing a deficit of ice-class cargo vessels for its gigantic Northern Sea Route project as the nation cannot build the fleet on its own, according to Deputy Prime Minister Yury Trutnev.】

item.title: 国家机构警告：荷兰不太可能实现气候目标
item.description: 一家国家机构警告说，如果政府不采取果断的政策，荷兰要实现欧盟大幅减排的约束性目标似乎遥不可及。【原文：The Netherlands’ ability to reach the European Union’s binding target of significantly reducing emissions appears out of reach with no decisive government policy, a state agency has warned.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利与 Climeworks 达成碳清除协议
item.description: 摩根士丹利已与 Climeworks AG 达成协议，为清除大气中的二氧化碳提供资金，摩根士丹利与摩根大通公司等华尔街重量级企业一起，为这项新兴技术提供支持。【原文：Morgan Stanley has entered into a deal with Climeworks AG to finance the removal of CO2 from the atmosphere, joining other Wall Street heavyweights including JPMorgan Chase & Co. in throwing its weight behind the nascent technology.】

item.title: 更多公司放弃垃圾碳抵消，但新买家迫在眉睫
item.description:
尽管联合国气候峰会上的交易有可能卷土重来，但企业采购商仍在远离被监督机构评为无效的项目。【原文：

Corporate purchasers are moving away from projects rated ineffective by a watchdog even as dealmaking at the UN climate summit offers potential for a comeback.

】

item.title: 维诺德-科斯拉谈埃隆-马斯克对特朗普、经济和气候的错误认识
item.description:
"气候债务比经济债务更难偿还，"科斯拉风险投资公司（Khosla Ventures）创始人维诺德-科斯拉（Vinod Khosla）在本周的Zero节目中说道。【原文：

“Climate debt is much harder to pay off than economic debt,” Vinod Khosla, founder of Khosla Ventures, says on this week’s episode of Zero.

】

item.title: 世界上使用量第二大的材料需要改头换面
item.description:
混凝土在碳排放中占很大比例。替代品正在出现，但繁文缛节阻碍了它们的发展。【原文：

Concrete accounts for a big percentage of carbon emissions. Alternatives are emerging, but red tape stands in the way.

】

item.title: 中国太阳能股价因预期的限产政策而上涨
item.description: 多晶硅是太阳能组件的关键材料，中国多晶硅生产商的股票延续了大幅上涨的势头，原因是市场预期政府将在供应严重过剩的情况下出台一项抑制生产的政策。【原文：Shares in Chinese manufacturers of polysilicon, a key material in solar components, extended a sharp rally on expectations the government will roll out a policy to curb production amid severe oversupply.】

item.title: 俄亥俄州数据中心必须支付最低电费
item.description: 根据俄亥俄州最大的公用事业公司之一周三提交的一份和解协议，俄亥俄州的大型数据中心至少要支付其所需能源的 85%，以支付电网改造的费用。【原文：Big data centers in Ohio will have to pay a minimum of 85% of the energy they need to cover the costs of grid improvements under a settlement submitted Wednesday by one of the state’s largest utilities.】

item.title: 盖茨说：巴西的政治摇摆阻碍了保护亚马逊的努力
item.description: 亿万富翁、慈善家比尔-盖茨（Bill Gates）说，巴西为减缓森林砍伐所做的努力令人鼓舞，但政治上的动荡使其很难获得保护亚马逊所需的投资。【原文：Brazil’s efforts to slow deforestation are encouraging, but political swings have made it tough to get the investment needed to protect the Amazon, billionaire philanthropist Bill Gates said.】

item.title: Impax 称 500 亿美元投资组合将增加信贷风险
item.description: 安派克斯资产管理公司（Impax Asset Management）希望大幅提高其信贷风险敞口，因为这家总部位于伦敦、资产规模达 500 亿美元的投资者正试图说服客户，更加多元化的收入基础将有助于恢复增长。【原文：Impax Asset Management wants to considerably beef up its credit exposure as the $50 billion London-based investor tries to persuade clients a more diversified revenue base will help revive growth.】

item.title: 冰岛著名的间歇泉谷神秘苏醒
item.description: 冰岛的豪卡达鲁尔地热区出现了意想不到的活动，导致沉睡多年的间歇泉突然喷出高达两米（6.6 英尺）的水柱。【原文：Iceland’s Haukadalur geothermal area has experienced unexpected activity, causing geysers that have been dormant for years to suddenly spout up to two meters (6.6 feet).】

item.title: NextEra 公司 "非常有兴趣 "恢复已关闭的爱荷华州核电厂
item.description: NextEra Energy Inc. 首席执行官约翰-凯彻姆（John Ketchum）表示，该公司正在评估重新启动其位于爱荷华州的已关闭的杜安-阿诺德核电站。【原文：NextEra Energy Inc. is evaluating the restart of its shuttered Duane Arnold nuclear plant in Iowa, according to Chief Executive Officer John Ketchum.】

item.title: 巴西利用新的牛群追踪系统打击毁林行为
item.description: 巴西正在加紧实施追踪牛群的计划，因为这个世界上最大的牛肉生产国正面临着防止商品生产造成森林砍伐的国际压力。【原文：Brazil is pressing ahead with plans to track its cattle herds as the world’s largest beef producer contends with international pressure to prevent deforestation caused by commodity production.】

item.title: 世界银行将把农业资金增加一倍，达到 90 亿美元
item.description: 在发展中国家面临气候风险和新出现的就业缺口的情况下，世界银行将把农业投资增加一倍，以实现农业部门的转型。【原文：The World Bank is set to double farming investments as it seeks to transform the agriculture sector amid climate risks and emerging job gaps in the developing world.】

item.title: 世界有风的问题
item.description: 今天的时事通讯探讨了为什么全球很有可能无法实现到2030年将可再生能源发电量增加两倍的目标。在下个月巴库联合国气候峰会结束之前，您可以在彭博网站上免费阅读本篇报道以及 COP29 的所有最新报道。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at why there is a serious risk of missing a global target to triple renewable capacity by 2030. You can read this story — and all of the latest COP29 coverage on Bloomberg.com — for free until the end of the UN climate summit in Baku next month.】

item.title: 特朗普可以给电动车革命踩刹车，但无法阻止它的发展
item.description:
随着新工作岗位、工厂和驾驶传道者的涌现，电动汽车的转型已过了临界点。【原文：

With a wave of new jobs, factories and driving evangelists, the electric car transition is well past its tipping point.

】

item.title: 香港首次发现恐龙化石
item.description: 香港（美联社）— 香港官员周三表示，他们首次在香港一个偏远、无人居住的岛屿上发现了恐龙化石，该岛屿是地质公园的一部分。【原文：HONG KONG (AP) — Officials in Hong Kong said Wednesday they have discovered dinosaur fossils in the city for the first time on a remote, uninhabited island that's part of a geopark.】

item.title: 木材新经济正在加利福尼亚慢慢扎根
item.description:
在容易发生野火的西部各州，一批年轻的企业正在将木材废料转化为利润。但是，杂草丛生的森林规模巨大，这是一个挑战。【原文：

A crop of young businesses is turning wood waste into profit in wildfire-prone western states. But the scale of overgrown forests is a challenge.

】

item.title: GE Vernova 将拆除南塔基特附近的部分涡轮叶片
item.description: 通用电气弗诺瓦公司（GE Vernova）周三表示，在今年早些时候发生备受瞩目的故障后，该公司将拆除马萨诸塞州楠塔基特附近海上风电场的部分涡轮机叶片，并加固其他叶片。【原文：GE Vernova will remove some turbine blades and strengthen others at an offshore wind farm near Nantucket, Massachusetts, after a high-profile failure earlier this year, the company said Wednesday.】

item.title: 氢气初创企业 Verdagy 在危险时刻开设加利福尼亚工厂
item.description:
即使氢气需求增长缓慢，该公司仍在加紧建设电解槽工厂。【原文：

The company is firing up its electrolyzer factory even as hydrogen demand has been slow to grow.

】

item.title: 风能危机阻碍世界实现绿色能源目标
item.description:
虽然太阳能的部署正在加速，但风能产业的瓶颈正在危及实现到 2030 年将可再生能源发电能力增加两倍这一全球目标的机会。【原文：

While solar deployment is accelerating, bottlenecks in the wind industry are jeopardizing the chance to meet a global target to triple renewable capacity by 2030. 

】

item.title: 让投资者 "无法抗拒 "的房地产赌注
item.description:
投资者们打赌，将棕色建筑改造成绿色地产有可能成为一项利润丰厚的业务。【原文：

Investors are betting that flipping brown buildings into green properties has the potential to become a hugely profitable business.

】

item.title: 造成 1,000 多名非洲人死亡的洪灾将成为家常便饭
item.description: 世界天气归因计划（World Weather Attribution initiative）的合作科学家称，今年在非洲萨赫勒地区造成1000多人死亡的洪灾将因气候变化而成为常事。【原文：Floods that killed more than 1,000 people this year across Africa’s Sahel region will become a regular occurrence because of climate change, according to scientists collaborating under the World Weather Attribution initiative.】

item.title: 太阳能制造商首席执行官称，如果废除《爱尔兰共和军法案》，美国经济将受到影响
item.description: 太阳能设备制造商恩法斯能源公司（Enphase Energy Inc.【原文：The head of solar equipment maker Enphase Energy Inc. said eliminating the clean-energy incentives in President Joe Biden’s signature climate legislation would be bad for the US economy.】

item.title: 对冲基金老将在新兴市场风险领域进行罕见的 SRT 交易
item.description: 一批对冲基金的资深人士已同意购买美洲开发银行集团贷款组合的部分风险，这标志着资产负债表风险的罕见转移，可能成为帮助多边贷款机构增加贷款的典范。【原文：A group of hedge-fund veterans has agreed to buy part of the risk on a loan portfolio from the Inter-American Development Bank Group, marking a rare transfer of balance-sheet exposure that could become a model to help multilateral lenders ratchet up lending.】

item.title: 纽约市兰德提议在私人市场撤资化石燃料
item.description: 纽约市主计长布拉德-兰德（Brad Lander）提议，作为减少温室气体排放承诺的一部分，纽约市养老基金应停止在私人市场的化石燃料投资。【原文：New York City Comptroller Brad Lander proposed ending fossil-fuel investments in private markets by the city’s pension funds as part of a pledge to cut greenhouse gas emissions.】

item.title: 生产锂既慢又脏。有解决办法吗？
item.description: 对绿色能源革命至关重要的一种物质--锂，正面临着未来供应紧张的风险。【原文：A substance seen as critical to the green energy revolution, lithium, is at risk of a future supply crunch.】

item.title: 菲律宾因暴风雨关闭办公室和学校而取消外汇交易
item.description: 受热带风暴 "特拉米 "影响，菲律宾主要吕宋岛政府工作和课程暂停，周三取消了货币交易。【原文：The Philippines canceled currency trading on Wednesday following a suspension of government work and classes in the main Luzon island due to tropical storm Trami.】

item.title: 美国财政部延长太阳能硅片厂的税收优惠政策
item.description: 根据一项新规定，美国的太阳能硅片生产项目将有资格获得 25% 的税收抵免，这将释放对国内设备生产的投资。【原文：Solar wafer manufacturing projects in the US will qualify for a 25% tax credit under a new rule that could unlock investment in domestic production of the equipment.】

item.title: 中国掀起气候资金争夺战
item.description: 今天的通讯将关注下月在阿塞拜疆举行的联合国气候峰会上最热门的话题之一：中国作为发展中国家的地位。您也可以在 Bloomberg.com 上找到完整报道。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at what will be one of the hottest topics at the UN climate summit in Azerbaijan next month: China’s status as a developing nation. You can also find the full story on Bloomberg.com.】
